# Sentence Structure: [Location] [Subject] [Verb], [Object] [Verb]?
### Possible Sentence Structure: 1. **[Subject] は [Location] に いる。** → (Bears are at the door.) 2. **[Object] を [Verb] ました か？** → (Did you leave the garbage out?)
#### Clues: - The verb **いる** is used for living things. - The verb **出す** needs to be conjugated into past tense. - The question should use **か** at the end. - Don't forget particles to connect the words correctly!
## Considerations: - This is a command sentece with two parts connected by a coma - The first part is stating a location where something exists - The second part is asking about a past action
